Quick search

Presentation¶

Stéganô is a pure Python steganography module.

Steganography is the art and science of writing hidden messages in such a way that no one, apart from the sender and intended recipient, suspects the existence of the message, a form of security through obscurity. Consequently, functions provided by Stéganô only hide messages, without encryption. Steganography is often used with cryptography.

Stéganô implements these methods of hiding:

  • using the red portion of a pixel to hide ASCII messages;
  • using the Least Significant Bit (LSB) technique;
  • using the LSB technique with sets based on generators (Sieve for Eratosthenes, Fermat, Mersenne numbers, etc.);
  • using the description field of the image (JPEG and TIFF).

Moreover some methods of steganalysis are provided:

  • steganalysis of LSB encoding in color images;
  • statistical steganalysis.

Requirements¶

  • Python 3;
  • Pillow;
  • piexif.

Turorial¶

  • Installation
  • Using Stéganô as a Python module
    • LSB method
    • LSB method with sets
    • Description field of the image
  • Using Stéganô in command line
    • The command stegano-lsb
    • The command stegano-lsb-set
    • The command stegano-red
  • Steganalysis
    • Parity

You can also have a look at the unit tests.
